text:
I am trying to use the JspC task as a precompiler for tomcat.  A number of files
have numbers at the beginning of their names, i.e. 404.jsp.  Tomcat handles this
by compiling the file to _404.java which is a valid file name for use with javac
(because the class doesn't start with a number).  However, the JspC task in ant
compiles 404.jsp to 404.java, which causes much nastiness when attempting to
compile (either with the ant javac task or with Jasper/javac).
Thanks,
Jason
creator: jcorley@togethersoft.com
stevel@apache.org
text:
If it exists in jasper on the command line, then the bug is in their code; we
have some of their name mapping cut and pasted into ours.

but we could fix it our side and send them the patch...
Can you try this with tomcat 4.18?
creator: stevel@apache.org

text:
I have tried to compile a 404.jsp with <jspc/> using ant 1.6alpha and Apache 
Tomcat/4.1.12-LE-jdk14 (jasper-compiler.jar, jasper-runtime.jar and servlet.jar 
from $CATALINA_HOME/common/lib in the CLASSPATH).
I get now with both ant and tomcat a file called _404_jsp.java.

So I am closing the issue as WORKSFORME.
Maybe there was a problem with older versions of Tomcat or of ant.
Or maybe the jar files used to run the ant jspc task were not the originial 
Tomcat jarfiles ? 

Cheers,

Antoine
